title: Tuna Satay Skewers
summary: Tuna Satay Skewers might be a good recipe to expand your main course recipe box. This gluten free, dairy free, and pescatarian recipe serves 2 and costs $8.77 per serving. One portion of this dish contains around 57g of protein, 30g of fat, and a total of 555 calories. Only a few people made this recipe, and 1 would say it hit the spot. Head to the store and pick up sriracha, soy sauce, peanut butter, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the light coconut milk you could follow this main course with the Lemon Coconut Milk Scones (with Blackberry Chia Jam) as a dessert. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 44 minutes. It is brought to you by recipes.prevention.com. Overall, this recipe earns a great spoonacular score of 87%. Similar recipes include Chicken skewers with satay dip, Chicken Satay Skewers, and Satay (Grilled Skewers).

winePairing.pairingText: Tuna can be paired with Merlot, Pinot Noir, and rosé Wine. Though fish is often paired with white wine, 'meatier' fish like tuna can absolutely go with red wine. A Rosé will also pair nicely, particularly if your tunan is prepared with ingredients better suited to a white wine. You could try Nickel & Nickel Harris Vineyard Merlot. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.2 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 40 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Nickel & Nickel Harris Vineyard Merlot
productMatches.description: Bright red fruits, candied blueberry, Santa Rosa plum and menthol aromas all blend together to intoxicate the nose as the 2016 Harris Vineyard Merlot wafts from the glass. On the palate, a juicy and fruity entry is supported by chewy tannins and a balancing acidity, creating lush layers that coat the tongue and produce a soft, elegant finish.
